basics.name: Lara Karki (Schenck)
basics.label: she/her
basics.summary: Artist and software developer now researching nontraditional pathways to computing careers.
interests: Workforce development and communities of practice

research.summary: Community-based participatory research to understand how mid-skill data work can be a pathway to technical career growth. Assume the role of Career Development Coordinator for DataWorks at Georgia Tech.
highlights: Develop workplace curriculum in job search and professional networking for career transitioning adults.
Focus on informal learning and catalyzing self-sustaining workplace communities of practice.

research.summary: Investigation into gatekeeping practices that affect informally trained developers in industry computing communities. Collaboration with Dr. Felienne Hermans.
highlights: Mixed methods research to understand how developers construct their understanding of "real" programming.

work.summary: Initiated human-centered AI research initiative to drive pharmaceutical sales product innovation, translating complex business challenges into actionable research frameworks and technology adoption strategies; delivered strategic recommendations to VP and executive leadership.
highlights: Architected modular user interface system, build tools, testing, and coding standards to speed up development time, reduce technical debt, and deploy shared packages across network.
Developed workflows to improve inter-departmental communication with engineering.
Led and deployed re-platform and upgrade initiatives across the network.
Advocated for diversity, equity, and inclusion in team culture, hiring, and compensation.

work.summary: Full stack web engineering and technical leadership on a product and engineering team of 80 people maintaining a network of 25+ high traffic websites.
highlights: Architected modular user interface system, build tools, testing, and coding standards to speed up development time, reduce technical debt, and deploy shared packages across network.
Developed workflows to improve inter-departmental communication with engineering.
Led and deployed re-platform and upgrade initiatives across the network.
Advocated for diversity, equity, and inclusion in team culture, hiring, and compensation.

work.summary: Developed curriculum and instructed web development courses for adult learners with non-traditional backgrounds.
highlights: University of Southern California, WordPress Development – Los Angeles, 2018
Girl Develop It, multiple workshops – National, 2015-2018
Pratt Institute of Design, UI/UX Prototyping in Code and Coding I-II – NYC, 2015-2016
Decoded, Code in A Day Workshop Facilitator – NYC, 2014-2016
Noble Desktop, WordPress.org – NYC, 2015
General Assembly, Front-end Web Development Lead Instructor – NYC, 2014

work.summary: Contract front-end and WordPress development and training for startups and small to large businesses and web development agencies.

volunteer.summary: Advise CEO of a membership network empowering formerly-incarcerated people with financial and mentorship opportunities.
Provide instructor support twice per week for Intro to Computer Science at Westinghouse Academy, a public school in an underserved neighborhood of Pittsburgh.
Active member, organizer, and contributor in open source WordPress communities.
highlights: Facilitated weekly Core CSS team meetings to oversee and contribute code to long-term projects improving the maintainability of the WordPress Core CSS code-base.
Contribute code updates to WordPress Core.
Organize community meetups and conferences vital to maintaining and growing the open-source community.

volunteer.summary: Participate in the core organizing group and mentorship program of the local Pittsburgh chapter of Showing Up for Racial Justice. Co-organized group session focused on racial justice in tech.
Development, ongoing maintenance, and technical advising for the C4AA on their WordPress website and donation platform.

speaking: Generative Art With FizzBuzz in CSS (invited) at CodeDay – online, 2021
Is CSS a Programming Language? at Abstractions – Pittsburgh, 2019

Let’s Build A Gutenberg Block Workshop at WordCamp EU – Belgrade, 2018
Let’s Build A Gutenberg Block at WordCamp San Diego – San Diego, 2018
The Five-figure WordPress Website at Abstractions – Pittsburgh, 2016
Vetting and Choosing Themes at WordCamp Pittsburgh – Pittsburgh, 2016
Why the Designer Failed FizzBuzz at SassConf – Austin, 2015
Freelancing, Real Talk at WordCamp NYC – NYC, 2014
outreach: Mentor, Learn Teach Code – Los Angeles and online, 2017-2021
Mentor, Global Diversity CFP Day – Los Angeles, 2018
Founder and organizer, CodePen Meetup NYC – NYC, 2014-2016

'I get hives when I come on here': Persisting Through Platform-Delivered Microaggressions on LinkedIn. Proc. ACM Hum.-Comput. Interact. 9, 7, Article CSCW232 (November 2025), 36 pages. https://doi.org/10.1145/3757413

Lara Karki, Dana Priest, James G. Dubose, Zajerria Godfrey, Annabel Rothschild, Ben Rydal Shapiro, and Betsy DiSalvo. 2025. A Window into DataWorks: Developing an Integrated Work-Training Curriculum for Novice Adults. In Proceedings of the 56th ACM Technical Symposium on Computer Science Education V. 1 (SIGCSETS 2025). Association for Computing Machinery, New York, NY, USA, 568–574. https://doi.org/10.1145/3641554.3701826

Proc. ACM Hum.-Comput. Interact. 8, CSCW1, Article 156 (April 2024), 24 pages. https://doi.org/10.1145/3637433.

posters.cite: Lara L. Schenck and Betsy DiSalvo. 2023. "From Data Work to Data Science: Getting Past the Gatekeepers." In ICER 2023. DOI.
Lara L. Schenck and Betsy DiSalvo. "Computational Work + Workplace Learning: A Pathway to Computing Careers for Adults." IPaT Industry Innovation Day and the GVU Research Showcase. 2023.

skills: Artificial Intelligence: Responsible AI, human-centered AI, AI product adoption and applications, workforce impacts
Development: Full-stack web engineering (PHP, JS, React, HTML/CSS), software architecture (design systems), Python (pandas)
Research: Applied research, qualitative analysis, mixed-methods, ethnography, engaged scholarship
